documents.title: Rudi Dekkers Huffman Aviation
documents.text: Rudi Dekkers purchased Huffman Aviation in 1999, a flight school that offered training for private pilot, instrument rating, commercial pilot license, multi-engine ratings, and flight instructor certifications, but not for larger jet aircraft. Atta and al-Shehhi attended Huffman Aviation to learn to fly small aircraft, meeting Dekkers in July 2000. The school filed M-1 student visa request forms for them in August 2000 to allow enrollment in a professional pilot program. Following the attacks, the FBI investigated Huffman Aviation, seizing records that showed Atta and al-Shehhi paid $10,000 for two months of flight instruction. Dekkers cooperated with the FBI, providing records and stating that he saw no red flags. After the attacks, Dekkers experienced bankruptcy, lost his business and house, divorced, and received death threats. He also faced issues with the Internal Revenue Service, lenders, and the Federal Aviation Administration. In March 2002, Huffman Aviation was cited for safety concerns, including unlocked fuel trucks with keys in the ignition. Dekkers sold Huffman Aviation in 2003. He stated in 2011 that Atta and al-Shehhi never displayed behaviors indicative of terrorists, though Atta was described as a "dead man walking" due to his demeanor. Dekkers maintained his innocence, stating he could not have done anything about the attacks and that he lived with the impact of 9/11 daily.

documents.title: Ila Pant 印度政治家
documents.text: Ila Pant, an Indian politician, was born on March 10, 1938, in the Nainital region of Uttarakhand. She is the daughter of Shobha and Govind Ballabh Pande and graduated from Allahabad University with a Bachelor of Arts degree. On June 20, 1957, she married Krishna Chandra Pant, a politician from an Uttarakhand Brahmin family, and they have two sons. Ila Pant's father-in-law, Govind Ballabh Pant, was a key figure in India's modernization and a senior leader of the Indian National Congress. Her husband also later became a minister. Ila Pant won the 1998 general election as a candidate for the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in the Nainital constituency, securing 38.52% of the votes and defeating former Chief Minister and Congress leader Narayan Dutt Tiwari by a margin of 15,557 votes. During 1998-99, she served as a member of the Standing Committee on External Affairs and the Consultative Committee of the Ministry of External Affairs. She also held positions on the board of Pant Nagar University and as secretary of the G.B. Pant Memorial Society in New Delhi.

documents.title: Ila Pant, Indian Politician
documents.text: Ila Pant, an Indian politician and member of the Lok Sabha from Uttarakhand, was born in Nainital on March 10, 1938. She completed her schooling in Nainital and pursued her Bachelor of Arts at the University at Allahabad. Ila Pant has shown a strong interest in development initiatives within her constituency in Nainital and other districts of Kumaon. She has been instrumental in organizing memorial lectures delivered by prominent figures such as former Presidents and Vice-Presidents of India, a former Chief Justice of the Supreme Court, industrialists, and academicians. Her involvement extends to overseeing activities across 50 centers throughout Uttarakhand. Additionally, she and society members were responsible for publishing 18 volumes of the Selected works of Govind Ballabh Pant, authored by Doctor BR Nanda.

documents.title: (Mis-)Interpretations of the Theory of Relativity – Considerations on How They Arise and How to Analyze Them
documents.text: abstract during einstein’s lifetime, the special and general theories of relativity were quite frequently interpreted by philosophers. most of these interpretations actually were mis interpretations. even today interpretative statements about relativity theory are often false or highly misleading. why is this so? in my ph.d. dissertation (hentschel 1990a ), i analyzed (mis)interpretations by 10 different philosophical schools active in the early twentieth century which widely differed in their approaches, emphasis and blind spots. many of these interpreters – including philosophers of high standing such as ernst cassirer, moritz schlick or joseph petzoldt – had studied the theory intensely and many even had close contact with einstein himself or with one of the members of his “protective belt” of close friends and allies. rather than declaring all of these...abstract during einstein’s lifetime, the special and general theories of relativity were quite frequently interpreted by philosophers. most of these interpretations actually were mis interpretations.

documents.title: Kentaro Yano: A Life in Differential Geometry
documents.text: Kentaro Yano was a Japanese mathematician whose interest in differential geometry was ignited by Albert Einstein's visit to Japan during his childhood. He pursued his studies in this field at the University of Tokyo and later in Paris under Élie Cartan, with whom he collaborated. Following his return to Tokyo, Yano continued his research and teaching, publishing "Geometry of Connections" during World War II. Post-war, he expanded his work into global differential geometry, studying with Bochner at Princeton and publishing "Curvature and Betti numbers." Yano's career involved extensive international travel for lectures and collaborations, contributing significantly to the field with numerous books, including "Groups of Transformations in Generalized Spaces" and "Differential geometry on complex and almost complex spaces." Even after retiring, he remained actively engaged in research and international collaborations, further solidifying his profound influence on differential geometry.

documents.title: Selected Papers of Kentaro Yano
documents.text: When Albert Einstein visited Japan in 1922, he gave lectures on the theory of relativity. The Japanese people were curious about this theory, believing it was so complex that only twelve people worldwide truly understood it. However, Kentaro Yano's father, a sculptor, encouraged him by stating that the theory was not created by God but by a human named Albert Einstein. He expressed confidence that Yano could understand it with diligent study. This encouragement motivated Yano to pursue mathematics, leading him to study differential geometry and eventually contribute significantly to the field.

documents.text: albert einstein has become the icon of modern science. following his scientific, cultural, philosophical, and political trajectory, this course aims to track the changing role of physics in the 20th and 21st centuries. this history course addresses einstein's engagement with relativity, quantum mechanics, nazism, nuclear weapons, philosophy, the arts, and technology, and raises basic questions about what it means to understand physics in its broader history. participants in the course will follow seventeen lessons, each of which will present a mix of science (no prerequisites!) and the broader, relevant cultural surround. some weeks will examine the physics concepts, while others will see excerpts of films or discuss modernist poetry that took off from relativity. or we might be looking at the philosophical roots and philosophical consequences of einstein’s...albert einstein has become the icon of modern science. following his scientific, cultural, philosophical, and political trajectory, this course aims to track the changing role of physics in the 20th

documents.title: Shai - If I Ever Fall In Love
documents.text: Shai originated at Howard University as a project for a talent show. The group's members discovered the potential of their combined voices, leading them to believe their collaboration could develop into something more significant. Group member Carl Martin conceived the song "If I Ever Fall In Love" in early 1992 while driving back to campus from Louisiana after the Christmas break. He felt the radio needed fresh material and conceived the song mentally in approximately fifteen minutes, noting its memorability upon his arrival at campus. Martin shared the song with his bandmates, and they performed a portion of it alongside Boyz II Men songs at the talent show. They refined the harmonies and presented the complete song at an open-mic night, receiving a positive audience response. A demo was created and presented to the Howard radio station, WHUR, but it was not played. Undeterred, Martin approached DJ Paco Lopez of the local station WPGC at a charity softball game in August and sang the song for him. Lopez received the demo and played it the following day for a group of women at the station, who reacted enthusiastically, convincing the program director of the song's potential hit status. WPGC, a leading station in Washington, DC, began playing the demo, generating significant listener response. Shai subsequently signed with Gasoline Alley, which released the song in October. The song's popularity grew rapidly due to airplay on WPGC, leading other stations nationwide to feature it, and it achieved considerable success, spending eight weeks at number two in the United States.

documents.title: Shai (band) - Wikipedia
documents.text: Shai, a Swahili word meaning "personification of destiny," was formed on the campus of Howard University. In 1990, Alpha Phi Alpha fraternity brothers, Marc Gay, Carl Martin, and Darnell Van Rensalier invited fellow Howard University student Garfield Bright to join their a capella group. The group came together seriously after winning a Howard University talent show. From there, they decided to pursue a record deal in New York City but did not receive any offers. Martin later gave Paco Lopez, a local deejay at WPGC radio in DC metro, a demo cassette copy of "If I Ever Fall in Love," and he began promoting the single on the air. In September 1992, the group signed with Gasoline Alley/MCA Records and released their debut album later that year.

documents.title: Shai (band) - Wikipedia
documents.text: Shai, an American vocal R&B/soul quartet, formed on the campus of Howard University. The name Shai is a Swahili word meaning "personification of destiny." The group gained prominence in the 1990s, best known for their 1992 debut single "[If I Ever Fall in Love]," which reached number two on the Billboard Hot 100. The members, who were fraternity brothers and fellow students, initially performed for fun before seriously pursuing a record deal after winning a talent show. Their debut album of the same name achieved platinum status.

documents.title: ACS Award in Pure Chemistry
documents.text: The American Chemical Society Award in Pure Chemistry is presented annually by the American Chemical Society to recognize and encourage fundamental research in pure chemistry conducted in North America by young individuals. Eligibility requires that nominees have achieved research of exceptional merit early in their careers, with a focus on independence of thought and originality. The award was first given in 1931 to Linus Pauling. Among the recipients listed is C. Frederick Koelsch in 1934.

documents.title: Past Recipients - American Chemical Society
documents.text: The ACS Award in Pure Chemistry recognizes and encourages fundamental research in pure chemistry carried out in North America by young men and women. Past recipients include C. Frederick Koelsch in 1934, Frank H. Spedding in 1933, and Oscar K. Rice in 1932. The award has been presented annually since at least 1931.

documents.text: “kossel, albrecht”的概念､定义､翻译､参考文献-科学参考｡单词 kossel, albrecht 释义 kossel, albrecht scientists (1853–1927) german biochemist born in rostock, germany, kossel was professor of physiology at the universities of marburg and heidelberg (1895–1923). he had first studied medicine, but turned his attention to biochemistry under the influence of felix hoppe-seyler, whose assistant he was at strasbourg (1877–81). kossel was also for a time a colleague of emil du bois-reymond. while with hoppe-seyler, kossel continued the latter's investigations of the cell substance called nuclein, demonstrating that it contained both protein and nonprotein (nucleic acid) parts. he was further able to show that the nucleic acids, when broken down, produced nitrogen-bearing compounds (purines and pyrimidines) as well as carbohydrates. kossel also studied the proteins in spermatozoa, being the first to isolate the amino acid histidine....“kossel, albrecht”的概念､定义､翻译､参考文献-科学参考｡单词 kossel, albrecht 释义 kossel, albrecht scientists (1853–1927) german biochemist born in rostock, germany, kossel was professor of physiology at the universities

documents.text: peo charles koller｡pius charles koller frse (in hungarian: koller károly pius; 4 march 1901 – 29 june 1979), known as peo charles koller, was a hungarian-born cytologist and cytogeneticist.lifekoller was born in nagykanizsa, hungary on 4 march 1901. he studied at the university of budapest graduating with a bsc in 1928, continuing as a postgraduate, gaining a phd.he left hungary in the years leading up to world war ii and relocated to scotland in the early 1930s. in 1933 koller obtained a dsc from the university of edinburgh with a thesis on the dynamics of chromosome movement. in 1937 he was elected a fellow of the royal society of edinburgh. his proposers were francis albert eley crew, alan william greenwood, sir alick buchanan-smith, baron balerno, and james nichol...peo charles koller｡pius charles koller frse (in hungarian: koller károly pius; 4 march 1901 – 29 june 1979), known as peo charles koller, was a hungarian-born cytologist and cytogeneticist.lifekoller

documents.text: acs award in pure chemistry｡the american chemical society award in pure chemistry is awarded annually by the american chemical society (acs) "to recognize and encourage fundamental research in pure chemistry carried out in north america by young men and women." "young" means born within 35 years of the awarding of the award, which takes place at the spring meeting of the acs. to be eligible, a nominee "must have accomplished research of unusual merit for an individual on the threshold of her or his career. special consideration is given to independence of thought and originality in the research...." the award was first awarded in 1931, with linus pauling the inaugural recipient. it is sponsored by the alpha chi sigma fraternity and the alpha chi sigma educational foundation. past...acs award in pure chemistry｡the american chemical society award in pure chemistry is awarded annually by the american chemical society (acs) "to recognize and encourage fundamental research in pure

documents.text: 60th birthday: wolfram koch｡wolfram koch, theoretical chemist and executive director of the gesellschaft deutscher chemiker (gdch, german chemical society), celebrates his 60th birthday on july 18, 2019. wolfram koch was born in darmstadt, germany. he studied chemistry at technische hochschule darmstadt (today technische universität darmstadt) and at technische universität (tu) berlin, germany. he received his ph.d. from tu berlin in 1986 under the supervision of helmut schwarz. in 1987–1988, he was an ibm postdoctoral fellow at the center for computational chemistry, ibm almaden research center, san jose, ca, usa. in 1988, he became senior scientist at the institute for supercomputing and applied mathematics at ibm germany’s scientific center in heidelberg. in 1992, koch returned to tu berlin as professor of theoretical organic chemistry. from 1998 to 2000, he...60th birthday: wolfram koch｡wolfram koch, theoretical chemist and executive director of the gesellschaft deutscher chemiker (gdch, german chemical society), celebrates his 60th birthday on july 18,

documents.text: coelsch, franz｡ 1 s . biographie k. besuchte die gymnasien in eichstätt und burghausen an der salzach, seit herbst 1895 studierte er medizin in erlangen, nach dem physikum in berlin und kiel. in den schluß-semestern in erlangen beeinflußten ihn der klinikeradolf strümpell und der polikliniker ￫ franz penzoldt; bei hausbesuchen empfing er erste einblicke in die soziale lage der kranken. nach approbation und promotion (1900) praktizierte k. in ebnath (nordostbayern), in der einsamkeit des fichtelgebirges völlig auf sich gestellt, und hatte gelegenheit zu kontakten mit industriearbeitern, vor allem solchen aus spiegelglas-, glasschleif-, porzellan- und spinnerei-betrieben. nach der physikatsprüfung 1903 und schriftlichen arbeiten aus den gebieten der gewerbe-hygiene und versicherungsmedizin war der berufliche werdegang k. s vorgezeichnet. auf grund von arbeiten vor allem zur arbeitsmedizin wurde er im januar...coelsch, franz｡ 1 s . biographie k. besuchte die gymnasien in eichstätt und burghausen an der salzach, seit herbst 1895 studierte er medizin in erlangen, nach dem physikum in berlin und kiel. in den
